Series.Actors: |J.G. Quintel|William Salyers|Sam Marin|Mark Hamill|Janie Haddad|Minty Lewis|Roger Craig Smith|
Series.Overview: Mordecai und Rigby, ein EichelhÃ¤her und ein WaschbÃ¤r, quÃ¤len sich mit ihren Hilfsarbeiten im Park herum. Ihr Chef Benson brummt ihnen immer neue Aufgaben auf, die sie mit vielen Tricks zu vermeiden suchen. SchrÃ¤ge Zeichentrickserie aus den USA, die eher was fÃ¼r Ã„ltere ist â€¦

Episode.Overview: Mordecai and Rigby have started their new job, and are pretty pleased with their lodgings. The only cloud on the horizon is the fact they have no furniture. Luckily, Pops is throwing out a chair he doesn't find comfortable, so the two decide to settle ownership with a game of Rock Paper Scissors.

Mordecai and Rigby try to write a hit song. When their coworkers doubt it, the duo try to prove themselves by showing their song to Really Cool Records. When that fails, Mordecai and Rigby propose a variant of their song as an idea for a ringtone but they keep it to themselves.

Episode.EpisodeName: Party Tonight - Regular Show 1 Million Fan Exclusive
Episode.Overview: OOOOOOOHHHHHHH!!! Regular Show's creator JG Quintel and Cartoon Network love all 1 Million of you so much, we had Mordecai, Rigby, and the rest of the park guys make this Party Tonight music video that's so awesome, it can only be described with three letters: R-A-D. You can only see it here, so thanks for being a Regular Show fan!!
A live action music video by the Regular Show Gang served as a "thank you" for 1 million Facebook likes. This short made its first appearance on Cartoon Network on April 17, 2012.

Quintel's 1st student film, "The Naive Man from Lolliland" tells the story of a foreign ambassador who visits the United States only to learn that his customs are unwelcome. Features an early inspiration for Pops.

Quintel's 2nd student film, "2 in the AM PM" tells the story of two slackers, who are left alone to run a convenience store on Halloween night, where candy filled with drugs creates a mini-nightmare. Features early inspirations for Mordecai and Benson.
Mordecai and Rigby must find a way to cover up a hole in the wall they created, and a magical keyboard they name 'The Power' might be just the thing for it.

A birthday party is scheduled in the park, and everyone has interesting jobs to do. That is, everybody but Mordecai and Rigby, who are only trusted with the lame job of setting up the chairs. In order to prove they are not slackers, the duo agree to set them up without being distracted.
Mordecai and Rigby need money in order to see their favourite childhood band. They decide to take on extra shifts, but soon start to tire out so they turn to coffee in order to stay awake.
Rigby suffers a final humiliation as he loses a fight to Mordecai over a video game. He turns to 'Death Kwon Do' in order to finally win one over his friend.

When Rigby digs up a good-looking plate from the garbage, he and Mordecai decide to use it by eating a piece of chocolate cake on it. As their efforts prove fruitless, they decide the only way forward is to convince the solitary Skips to have a birthday party.

The annual park barbecue has arrived, and Benson is so excited he has ordered premium hot dogs. When things go wrong, Mordecai blames Rigby for always making things worse, despite his claims that he can 'totally fix it.'
Mordecai and Rigby need to buy a grilled cheese sandwich for Benson, but can't be bothered to wait in line. Instead, they pretend to be astronauts, which results in them trying to out lie each other.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Unicorns Have Got To Go
Episode.Overview: In an effort to woo Margaret, Mordecai starts using a cologne that can supposedly attract women, called "Dude Time". Unfortunately, all it seems to attract are unicorns.
Mordecai and Rigby's constant prank calls result in one of their victims sending them back in time to the eighties.

When the park is going to be audited, the guys must find a way to sort their taxes out or face it being closed down. Mordecai suggests Rigby's accountant brother, Don, but Rigby must first get over a long running feud.
After gorging on snacks at the snack bar, Rigby suffers an unfortunate accident as his consciousness separates from his body.
After ordering a bunch of shirts for a fake band, Mordecai and Rigby find themselves having to learn to play for real to avoid looking like idiots at the local open mic night.
Rigby is haunted by nightmares about a possessed British taxi after watching a cheesy horror film. Mordecai is convinced that desensitising him is the only way to cure it.
When Mordecai and Rigby help Margaret move out of her house, Mordecai becomes jealous when Margaret starts to like Rigby.
Mordecai and Rigby learn the price of being appreciated at work after altering Benson's magic book of records.
Benson installs surveillance cameras in the workplace.
Mordecai and Rigby help Pops get over his fear of public speaking.

Muscle Man's incessant usage of outdated and confusing "My Mom" jokes during a day filled with pressing deadlines and assignments infuriates Mordecai, especially after Rigby decides to join in and issue more of his own jokes.
Looking to find respect, Mordecai and Rigby take on a video game high score at the coffee shop.

Mordecai and Rigby are about to beat "The Hammer" the supposedly unbeatable last boss in their new video game,but the TV breaks. Skips, Pops, Muscle Man, and High-Five Ghost want to see The Hammer lose and modernize the replacement TV.
Episode.Writer: J.G. Quintel, Mike Roth, John Infantino

Episode.Overview: When Benson takes the night off, Mordecai and Rigby decide to throw a party, but as it gets off on a rocky start, they seek the help of Party Pete to get their party going. But the duo soon learn the hard way that Party Pete is unstoppable when drinking RadiCola.

Episode.GuestStars: Jeff Bennett, Janie Haddad, Minty Lewis
Episode.Overview: Mordecai sees Pops naked and tries to forget about it. Rigby decides to help out by showing him an anime with supernatural powers. In turn, the anime ends up wiping out all of Mordecai's memories and it's up to Rigby and Skips to get back Mordecai's mind.

Episode.GuestStars: Steven Blum, April Stewart, David Stiers
Episode.Overview: Mr. Mallard demotes Benson due to Mordecai and Rigby slacking off on his time. Mordecai and Rigby teach Benson how to slack off, but end up teaching him too well.

After finding out their new game isn't as awesome as they thought, Mordecai and Rigby fruitlessly try to get their money back. In retaliation, Mordecai and Rigby sabotage the sale of the game so much they are pulled into the game by the manager and must defeat him to get their freedom and their refund.

Rigby finds an old tape with one of his former favorite songs on it, only to find that it's not as good as he remembers. Problem is, the song gets lodged in his brain and cannot stop humming or singing it so Mordecai tries various methods to get rid of it.
Mordecai and Rigby must go and get Muscle Man and his ex-girlfriend back together again after Muscle Man's broken heart costs them more work and an unwanted crush.
Rigby employs a beaver named Doug to do his work for him, but soon runs into issues.
Rigby got jinxed and has got to find a way to un-jinx himself so he can talk again. Only problem is, he can't tell anybody to say his name three times to un-jinx him.
Muscle Man invites everyone to High Five Ghost's birthday party, except for Mordecai and Rigby who decide to crash it.
Much to Skips' annoyance, Mordecai and Rigby start to overask each other for favors by saying "do me a solid."

Episode.GuestStars: Sam Marin, Jeff Bennett, Brendan Fraser
Episode.Overview: Mordecai and Rigby organize a scary movie fund-raiser for the park. They end up raising more than just funds.
Mordecai and Rigby injure Pops by wrestling him and in the end, have to take care of him during the night when Pops got them tickets to go to the wrestling championship.
When Skips kills Rigby, he must defeat Death in an arm wrestle competition to bring Rigby back.
Mordecai and Rigby compete against Muscle Man and High Five Ghost in a radio contest.
Mordecai and Rigby find a bunch of baby ducks when they are asked to clean the old fountain.
Fed up with being insulted all the time, Rigby decides to boost his intelligence with whatever methods he can find.
In this updated version of the pilot episode, Mordecai and Rigby answer a newspaper ad posted by Benson for two groundskeepers.
Mordecai and Rigby try to create a viral internet video for a bet with Muscle Man.
Rigby gets sprayed by a skunk and the duo try all kinds of methods to get the smell out.

Mordecai and Rigby spend a night at Carrey O'Key's Karaoke bar, but the song they sing (We're Not Gonna Take It) is so motivating that they accidentally begin talking trash about Benson, Pops and Skips.

Mordecai and Rigby are slacking off again, this time with a stick hockey table. Benson finds out and makes a deal with the two--if they finish all their work, they can play the game. However, when Benson goes against his word and sells it, Mordecai and Rigby must set out to retrieve it.
After losing a bet, Mordecai dyes his hair blonde and gets pulled into a shadowy blonde cult.
The gang must get Skips to rejoin their bowling team, or face losing their souls to Death.

A three-part Halloween special in which terrifying tales are told.
Creepy Doll: The guys discover an old doll that wants revenge on Pops.
Death Metal Crash Pit: A pit is haunted by a 1980s death-metal band.
In the House: On Halloween, Mordecai dresses up as a father with five "kids", to receive more candy, while Rigby goes as a robber and scares away people.
Mordecai, Rigby, Margaret and Eileen head to the mountains for a camping trip in their "secret spot."
The guys challenge Muscle Man and High Five Ghost to a basketball competition in order to win time to use the computer.
After wrecking the cart, Benson takes it away from Mordecai and Rigby and replaces it with two bikes. The guys make a deal with Benson that if he admits they are cool, he'll give it back to them.
Mordecai and Rigby are tired of Benson's new laws for the house, so they try to find a new place to stay that is free from rules.
When Pops is humiliated by a bunch of rappers, Mordecai and Rigby attempt to teach him to rap instead of recite poetry.
Influenced by a movie trailer, Mordecai and Rigby believe that a cool car can get you girls, much to the disgust of Margaret and Eileen.
The guys must erase graffiti in the park.
Mordecai and Rigby help Benson try to impress Audrey, but Chuck gets in the way of that.
Rigby swaps fortune cookies with Benson in hopes of improving his luck.
Pops bans Benson from yelling at Mordecai and Rigby, causing Benson to have a major meltdown.
Episode.Writer: |Kat Morris|Sean Szeles|Matt Price|Jack Thomas|John Infantino|Mike Roth|

Episode.Overview: Skips lacks computer skills and can't help Mordecai and Rigby master technology.
Episode.Writer: |Calvin Wong|Toby Jones|Matt Price|Jack Thomas|John Infantino|Mike Roth|

Episode.Overview: Mordecai accidentally calls Margaret and must find a way to erase the embarrassing message he left on her voicemail.
Episode.Writer: |Kat Morris|Sean Szeles|Matt Price|Jack Thomas|John Infantino|Mike Roth|

Episode.Overview: Mordecai tries to eat a large omelette in order to win a hat for Rigby.
Muscle Man wants to be appreciated at the park so he threatens to leave and take a job as a gut model.
Mordecai and Rigby enter a video game tournament to win a prototype video game controller called â€œThe Maximum Gloveâ€.
Mordecai and Rigby must tell Muscle Man that the scratch ticket they gave him was a fake.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Best Burger in the World
Episode.Overview: Mordecai and Rigby try to fool Benson so they can eat the best burgers in the world.
The guys fight for their jobs after Benson replaces them with an ostrich and a possum.
Rigby changes his name and quickly regrets his choice.

Mordecai and Rigby do Skips work for his birthday, but Skips hurts his hand. He was supposed to fight someone, but with his hands injured, Mordecai and Rigby must fight the person themselves with the Fists of Justice.
Mordecai thinks that Margaret is engaged, and he wants to find a girlfriend as soon as possible to try and get over her.
Mordecai and Rigby bust up the cart and have to go on a road trip with Benson to the dealership before the warranty expires.
Death will spare Muscle Manâ€™s life if Mordecai and Rigby babysit his kid.
Margret plans a last minute party at a local club so that she can dance. The List becomes their mortal enemy in this episode.
Rigby must prove he can complete a task or risk losing his job.
Muscle Man wants to spread his dad's ashes at the Big Rig Museum and needs Mordecai and Rigy's help getting there.
The guys plan a day with the cart before they have to get rid of it.
Muscle Man must learn to be a true gentleman in order to impress Starla's parents.

After being asked by Margret to water the plants, the duo discover a diary disaster down on the ground. They begin to repair it and make things worse. What secrets will be revealed in Margret's Diary?

Episode.EpisodeName: The Best VHS in the World
Episode.Overview: Mordecai and Rigby have to return an overdue VHS to the store so they won't be banned from renting new movies.
The gang wants to win a prank war against a rival park.
Mordecai and Rigby hope to impress Margaret and Eileen by taking a picture with Deathbear.
Pop's Birthday is coming up so the gane decide that they will purchase the Fuzzy dice that Pops wants, but it turns out they can't purchase the dice. They have to win them.
After Pops consumes a double glazed apple crisp, the gang must figure out a way to make Pops crash.
Mordecai finally tries to kiss Margaret, but Mordecai is left disappointed after it was cut short by his bad breath, and wants to go back in time to re-do it.
Mordecai and Rigby must save the park after the rest of the gang are brainwashed.
Mordecai and Rigby must save the park after the rest of the gang are brainwashed.
Mordecai and Rigby want to stop Muscle Man from screwing with Thomas.

Episode.EpisodeName: Terror Tales of the Park II
Episode.Overview: While on their drive to a Halloween party, Mordecai and Rigby tells scary stories to Benson, Pops, Skips, Muscle Man, High Five Ghost and Thomas.
Mordecai and Rigby sign up to be judges in a pie contest.
Benson wants to prove that he performed a famous drum solo.
Muscle Man starts to go bald.
Mordecai and Rigby have a guy's night.

Rigby has never been known for his upper-body strength, so when the park employees have to go into the doctor and get their physicals, Rigby has trouble doing even one pull up, and so he must find a way to do so or get fired.

The house is decorated, the guests have arrived and it seems like it's the season to save Christmas when the gang finds themselves faced with the task of destroying a present for Santa that has the potential to destroy them and the holiday.
Itâ€™s Margaretâ€™s last night of freedom before she transfers to a new college. So Mordecai, Rigby and Eileen decide to surprise her with the biggest party of her life. What could possibly go wrong?

After Mordecai, Rigby and Muscle Man squander the fireworks that Benson had purchased for an upcoming event at the park, the three have to go and find more to replace them before Benson blows a fuse and they lose their jobs.
Muscle Man tries not to contact Starla for an entire weekend.
Benson eats a magical, deadly sandwich that Mordecai and Rigby bought, so the trio must travel with the restaurant's manager, Sensei, to find the cure.
Mordecai and Rigby want to reunite the band Adrenaline.
Muscle Man, Rigby and Starla are annoyed about Mordecai's awkward goodbye to Margaret so they try to get Mordecai to tell Margaret how he feels about her.
Skips intervenes to stop his cousin's bad jokes.
When Mordecai and Rigby meet a caveman, they decide to put his unique prehistoric physique to good use: chugging cheese! But could this caveman actually turn out to be a Neanderthal nuisance?
Mordecai and Rigby help their favorite '80s sitcom star, RGB2, escape from the studio lot and into the mountains so he can avoid starring in a revival of his show.

Episode.EpisodeName: A Bunch of Full Grown Geese
Episode.Overview: Mordecai and Rigby must rid the park of troublesome geese.
Mordecai and Rigby want to win the grand prize on a Japanese game show.
Rigby stains Mr. Maellard's expensive white limousine with a meatball sub.
Mordecai offers Margaret a ride to the airport.
Muscle Man writes a song for Starla and decides to play it on his favorite radio station.
The guys enter a donut contest in hopes of winning a cameo on their favorite cop show.
Skips has to lower his stress for health reasons.
Thomas must save his brain after he chugs a slushy that freezes his brain.
Muscle Man tries to save his trailer after it fails a health inspection.
Mordecai plans to kiss Margaret at a meteor shower.
Mordecai tries to shake hands with Margaret's father.
The guys need to obtain a LaserDisc player in order to watch the director's cut of a cult classic.
Mordecai and Rigby must save the golf cart from rich people at a country club.
Benson must trust Mordecai and Rigby to help get him down a mountain.
The park employees want to give Benson a special mug.
Muscle Man wants to binge on his favorite foods before going on a diet.
The park employees must help Muscle Man to stop fighting in his sleep.
Mordecai and Rigby must save Benson from an evil party company.
Mordecai wants to ask Margaret to be his girlfriend.
Mordecai and Rigby venture off on a road trip to return Margaret's sweater, eventually getting pulled over in the process.
The guys try street-performing to earn money for a video game.
The guys try to fix a broken windshield in Benson's car.
The guys want to get Every Meat Burritos from the Jimbros' Burritos drive-thru.
Mordecai and Rigby must straighten up their room.
Mordecai and Rigby help Skips return a teenage Skips to the 1700s.
Mordecai and Rigby are charged with bringing Benson tortillas.

Episode.EpisodeName: Terror Tales of The Park III
Episode.Overview: The park staff make a bet about telling the scariest story at a Halloween party.
Pops surprises Mordecai and Rigby with the gift of tants â€“ pants which double as tables.
Rigby has to win a bet by beating a guy at the arcade game, Bank Shot.
Muscle Man wants to win the bodybuilding competition at his gym.
Mordecai and Rigby accidentally ruin Thanksgiving and must find a way to save it before their families arrive for dinner.
The guys want to get a stuntman license for Timmy's birthday party.
Rigby has to stop Mordecai from kissing a girl on New Yearâ€™s Eve.
The gang wants to win a dodge ball tournament.
Modecai and Rigby need to escape a portable toilet.
Hi-Five Ghost hopes to reunite with a lady from his past after receiving a long-awaited postcard from her.

Episode.EpisodeName: Rigby in the Sky With Burrito
Episode.Overview: Before his high school reunion, Rigby hopes to accomplish something he said he would do.

Episode.EpisodeName: Journey to the Bottom of the Crash Pit
Episode.Overview: The guys must venture into the bottom of the crash pit in order to find their video camera.
Thanks to Daylight Savings Time, Mordecai and Rigby must reset all the clocks in the park.
An electric guitar signed by a rock star must be replaced, so Mordecai, Rigby and Benson must find a replacement or Benson will be fired.
Skips tells Mordecai and Rigby the story of how he became immortal.

Episode.EpisodeName: Return of Mordecai and the Rigbys
Episode.Overview: Mordecai and Rigby compete in a battle of the bands to win an air conditioner.
When the guys damage an important painting of Benson, they must find a way to repair it.
Eileen has to make a music video for her introductory film class, but when Mordecai and Rigby volunteer to help her, she gets a little more than she bargained for.
Mordecai is a victim of auto-correct when he sends CJ a message.
Mordecai has a date with C.J., but he unfortunately also has to babysit Death's 300-year-old son, Thomas (from "Dead at Eight").
Rigby wants to redeem himself by winning on "Expert or Liar."
Pops wants to learn how to surf in order to catch a wave, but in the Surf School he meets other professional surfers who think he is not worthy to be a surfer.
Benson has to get to work on time so he can win a gold watch.
Mordecai and Rigby have to paint a house.
Mordecai and Rigby have to deliver a cake to Maellard's birthday party.

Skips tries to get back into the dating scene, resulting in Mordecai and Rigby making an account for him on a dating website. His account gets so popular, he ends up participating in a dating game show.
Thomas wants to get the park founder's statue back.
Skips must plan the perfect bachelor party for his cousin, Quips.
Mordecai and Rigby accidentally destroy CJ's brand-new tent.
Mordecai and CJ want to go on a romantic date.
Mordecai wants to get a mix tape from his parents' house.
Muscle Man goes to high school and tries to prove himself as being cooler than the new student on campus.
C.J. tries to win a "Cut the Cheeser's" card at a mini golf tournament.

Episode.EpisodeName: Terror Tales of the Park IV
Episode.Overview: The park workers try to keep Muscle Man awake by telling him scary stories in the car while driving to visit his mother.
Muscle Man wants help from the gang to finish his bucket list.
Rigby tries to prove he can earn a paycheck.
After Eileen wins a new TV at the City College dance competition, Rigby offers to set up Eileen's flat screen television for her.
Rigby grows suspicious of Thomas' activity and sets out to stop him.
The gang gets back at Muscle Man after he gives them bad gifts.
Mordecai has to make it through a Christmas party at Eileen's house with CJ without messing everything up when he finds out Margaret is invited.
While lamenting losing CJ to a kiss with Margaret, Mordecai turns to the Sad Sax Guy in the park to help him get CJ back.
Benson is invited to a luncheon with other park managers, but the other park workers think it is all a prank set up by the prankster manager Jean.
After staying up all night, Mordecai and Rigby try to sneak a nap in a crate at the park, only to wake up in Australia.
Muscle Man and Starla hope game show winnings will pay for their wedding
Eileen and the others want to watch baby sea turtles hatch and descend into the ocean.
The Discmasters must put an end to the Format Wars.
Mordecai and Rigby are determined to win a happy birthday song contest.
